content: Lei Zhang — 张雷 – Emerging Software Technologies Lab – UMBC Skip to main content Emerging Software Technologies Lab Menu Apply Search Search Context This Site All of UMBC Location ITE 444 Contact Phone: 410-455-3253Contact Us Lei Zhang [pronunciation: Ley Jahng] Assistant Professor Department of Information Systems University of Maryland, Baltimore County Baltimore, MD, U.S.A. Email: leizhang_at_ umbc.edu Office: ITE 444 LinkedIn Twitter GitHub     DBLP Google Scholar 0000-0001-9343-3654 Short Bio: Lei Zhang is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Information Systems at UMBC. His primary research interest is software engineering. He is particularly interested in understanding the interactions between software engineering and emerging technologies, such as quantum computing and machine learning. Lei also has over five years of software development experience as a software engineer and project coordinator outside academia. Before joining UMBC, he was a post-doctoral research fellow at Toronto Metropolitan University (formerly Ryerson University). Zhang received a Ph.D. in Computer Science from McMaster University. His master’s and bachelor’s degrees were received from The University of Hong Kong and Zhejiang University, respectively. For Prospective Students: Please read my announcement on the Lab Homepage. Thanks.
